intro: Vesalea coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf vesalea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a fine, granular texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Vesalea coriacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
